prompt: <description>**Part 1: Three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top and bottom** Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler angles to (0.0, 0.0, 0.0) and the translation vector to (0.0, 0.0, 0.3562). Create a new sketch on the X-Y plane (face_1) of the coordinate system. Create the first loop (loop_1) as follows: - Arc 1: Start point (0.0, 0.0937), mid point (0.2812, 0.0), end point (0.5625, 0.0937), - Line 1: Start point (0.5625, 0.0937), end point (0.5625, 0.6562), - Arc 2: Start point (0.5625, 0.6562), mid point (0.2813, 0.75), end point (0.0, 0.6562), - Line 2: Start point (0.0, 0.6562), end point (0.0, 0.0937). Close the loop (loop_1) and complete the sketch. Extrude the sketch using the following parameters: - Extrusion depth towards normal: 0.0, - Extrusion depth opposite normal: 0.3562, - Scaling parameter for the sketch: 0.75, - Operation: Combine bodies - New body. **Part 2: Three-dimensional, rectangular prism with rounded corners and edges** Create a new coordinate system. Set the Euler angles to (0.0, 0.0, 0.0) and the translation vector to (0.0234, 0.0234, 0.3562). Create a new sketch on the X-Y plane (face_1) of the coordinate system. Create the first loop (loop_1) as follows: - Arc 1: Start point (0.0, 0.0822), mid point (0.2578, 0.0), end point (0.5156, 0.0822), - Line 1: Start point (0.5156, 0.0822), end point (0.5156, 0.6209), - Arc 2: Start point (0.5156, 0.6209), mid point (0.2578, 0.7031), end point (0.0, 0.6209), - Line 2: Start point (0.0, 0.6209), end point (0.0, 0.0822). Close the loop (loop_1) and complete the sketch. Extrude the sketch using the following parameters: - Extrusion depth towards normal: 0.0619, - Extrusion depth opposite normal: 0.0, - Scaling parameter for the sketch: 0.7031, - Operation: Combine bodies - Join. The final shape is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with rounded corners. The prism has a length of 0.75 units, a width of 0.75 units, and a height of 0.4181 units.</description>

prompt: <description>**CAD Model Instructions** **Part 1: Base of the Cylindrical Object** Construct a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered middle section. 1. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and translation vector [0.0131, 0.375, 0.0131]. 2. Draw a face (face\\_1) and create a loop (loop\\_1) on it. 3. Create a circle (circle\\_1) in loop\\_1 with center at [0.2216, 0.2216] and radius of 0.2216. 4. Scale the 2D sketch using the scaling parameter of 0.4431. 5. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch with euler angles [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and translation vector [0.0131, 0.375, 0.0131]. 6. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with extrusion depths of 0.375 towards the normal and 0.0 towards the opposite direction of the normal respectively. **Part 2: Top of the Cylindrical Object** Construct a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side with a rectangular hole in the center of its side. 1. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and translation vector [0.0, 0.375, 0.0]. 2. Draw a face (face\\_1) and create a loop (loop\\_1) on it. 3. Create a circle (circle\\_1) in loop\\_1 with center at [0.2346, 0.2346] and radius of 0.2346. 4. Scale the 2D sketch using the scaling parameter of 0.4692. 5. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch with euler angles [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and translation vector [0.0, 0.375, 0.0]. 6. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with extrusion depths of 0.0 towards the normal and 0.375 towards the opposite direction of the normal respectively. **Final CAD Model** The final CAD model is a cylindrical object with a tapered top and a flat bottom. The top is slightly wider than the bottom. The object has a smooth surface and appears to be made of a solid material. The base and top are constructed separately using the above-mentioned steps. The base is a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered middle section. The top is a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side with a rectangular hole in the center of its side. The base and top are then joined together to form the final CAD model. The height of the object is 0.4431, the length is 0.4692, and the width is 0.375.</description>

<description>**Part 1: Cylindrical Object with a Tapered Top and Bottom** *Shape*: A cylindrical object with a slightly tapered top and bottom, resembling a ring or a washer. *Dimensions*: The length, width, and height of this part are all equal to 0.75 units. Remove the remaining material along the opposite normal direction for a final height of 0.386 units. This is the first part of the CAD Assembly process, creating a cylindrical object with a slightly tapered top and bottom.</description>

<description>Part 1: Rectangular Prism with a Flat Top and Bottom Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The length of the prism is twice the width, and the height is half the width. The prism is centered on a white background. 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0°, 0°, 0°] - Translation Vector: [0, 0, 0] 2. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with these properties: - Extrusion Depth Towards Normal: `0.0469` - Extrusion Depth Opposite Normal: `0` - Sketch Scale: `0.75` - Operation: NewBodyFeatureOperation (Create a new solid body) The final dimensions of this part will be as follows: - Length: `0.75` - Width: `0.75` - Height: `0.0469` *Note: No curves are present in this part, only lines.* Part 2: There is no further information about subsequent parts. By following these instructions, a junior CAD designer should be able to accurately generate the CAD model.</description>
